com.soen6441.ui.parallel

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.soen6441.ui.parallel.View
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EditingScene, GridView, GridViewCell, InspectorView, MainScene, NewMapScene, PlayingScene, SceneDemo, ViewDemo, ViewFlow, ViewFlowDemo, ViewFlowDemoScene1, ViewFlowDemoScene2

    public class View
extends javax.swing.JPanel

    Introduction

    A Parallel Class, which represents a view.



    Life Cycle

    Life Cycle - Initialization

    General Idea

    When a view is constructed using the constructor, it will call some hook methods.

    Every subclass of the View should know them, and put the correct code into the right method.

    1. init()

    The constructor first calls this method, so every subclass could use this method to initialize some essential properties.

    Getting some thing from model to the property, setting the size of the view should be put here.

    Attention: Scene is able to not set the size in this class. Because in default, it will be set to 800,600 in this method. So, if there is not any else things that a Scene wants to do in the init(), it can choose not to override this method.

    2. initSubviews()

    The constructor then call this method. Every subclass should use this method to create subviews.

    Creating, Modifying, Layouting the subviews should be put here.

    3. initEvents()

    The constructor finally call this method. It's time to link the events.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    Zhe Zhao
